variants.Description in input context: The E46K variant of α-synuclein is associated with Parkinson's disease.

Material used.Description: In vitro aggregation assays were performed using recombinant wild-type and E46K mutant α-synuclein proteins.

Readout description.Result Description: The E46K variant formed significantly more fibrils compared to wild-type α-synuclein.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type α-synuclein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Buffer without protein was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Fibril formation less than 20% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Fibril formation greater than 50% of wild-type levels.

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transiently transfected with plasmids expressing wild-type or E46K mutant α-synuclein.

Readout description.Result Description: E46K mutant α-synuclein showed increased intracellular aggregation and toxicity in HEK293 cells.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type α-synuclein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Intracellular aggregation levels less than 30% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Intracellular aggregation levels greater than 60% of wild-type levels.
